website_summaries.verdict: An affordable carbonating machine that is designed to be portable so you can take it with you to picnics and parties.
pros: This easy-to-use carbonator works on water, juice, iced tea wine, and more
The unit includes two 3-ounce CO2 cylinders that can carbonate up to 32 beverages
cons: The refill CO2 cylinders can be hard to find

customer_reviews.title: I really don't think anyone who buys this will have any reason to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the negative reviews. I've had SodaStream and I'm replacing it with this permanently. I make my own fruit extractions I strain out the pulp. Using the half liter bottle I make clear vegetable and fruit infusions. Examples are watermelon blueberry Ginger. Cherry raspberry Apple mint, lemon lime pomegranate. I rather make a small quantity at a time so .5 l is perfect for me. SodaStream CO2 tanks work just fine. The design overall and functionality should be the standard in the industry. This product the nature of it is by far superior to what's competing with it.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Unreasonably difficult to purchase and exchange co2 cylinders .
customer_reviews.text: Amazon does not sell the 3 oz co2 cylinders for this product. The manufacturer has an exchange program with participating stores but list only about a dozen stores in the entire country. Otherwise you have to do it by mail with the manufacturer and they will only do it for two or more cylinders so you have to buy extra to be able to participate. Bought this product based on recommendation from Epicurious. This makes me wonder if Epicurious takes kickbacks. This product is not worth owning. I feel duped.
customer_reviews.author: em

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Store; Home Depot for Refills
customer_reviews.text: Happy to have this seltzer water maker. Easy to use and store. I found I did not need a stand for the counter. It takes both 10L and 60L cartridges [the 10L cartridge came no way near making 10 liters; still on the 60L]. It is important to keep the attachment face at an angle when connecting the bottle to the equipment. Also make sure the water you are infusing is cold. I think it better hold the C02. I like sparkling water, but tap water tasted too much like chlorine. So I buy distilled water by the gallon for under a dollar. Refills from Home Depot are the best price, so far.
customer_reviews.author: LRICCI

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: We're enjoying the Drinkmate Spritzer at our home. I have given four stars because the CO2 cartridges seem to not hold many charges; it takes three one-second bursts to get a full fizz charge to the bottle of water, but you'll only be able to do this four or five times before you run out. We are considering going with a larger CO2 cartridge, but it will mean we have to get a stand for the device since it really won't be portable any more. But overall, we are happy with its capabilities and definitely like not collecting plastic bottles of fizz water.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Turner

customer_reviews.title: Make your own soda pop

Initially it was not easy to work out how to use it, even following the instructions. But once you get used to it it's relatively simple. Various syrup flavors available, they taste good.
